author: gcolvin
content:
>  it could be a good idea to generate EIP numbers somewhat randomly
Most organizations number documents sequentially, and documents are referred to by number.  That's how we've mostly been doing it, and no need to change.  Letting the bot assign sequential numbers gets rid of the gaps in the sequence.   Drafts are documents that need numbers too, and an editor's approval being needed to merge that first Draft makes sham transactions difficult enough, I think.

author: gcolvin
content: We have been following the RFC, BIP, and many other processes in assigning sequential document numbers, with occasional exceptions, and referring to documents unambiguously by number.  All I'm proposing is that we adopt (and automate) a policy of not making exceptions.  If we editors ignore our own policies we have a problem we can't fix with a bot.
